titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 427) to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide that major rules of the executive branch shall have no force or effect unless a joint resolution of approval is enacted into law; providing for proceedings during the period from July 30, 2015, through September 7, 2015; and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 427) to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide that major rules of the executive branch shall have no force or effect unless a joint resolution of approval is enacted into law; providing for proceedings during the period from July 30, 2015, through September 7, 2015; and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-230, by Mr. Collins (GA).
Resolution also provides for proceedings of the House during the period from July 30, 2015, through September 7, 2015.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 51.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 380.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 240 - 167 (Roll no. 470).

MOMENT OF SILENCE - The Chair asks that the House now observe a moment of silence in remembrance of our brave men and women in uniform who have given their lives in the service of our Nation in Iraq and in Afghanistan and their families, and all who serve in our Armed Forces and their families.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 240 - 167 (Roll no. 471).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 427) to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide that major rules of the executive branch shall have no force or effect unless a joint resolution of approval is enacted into law; providing for proceedings during the period from July 30, 2015, through September 7, 2015.
